item.title: Rumor: Popular Fortnite Feature Possibly Coming to Call of Duty: Warzone
item.description:
Call of Duty may be taking a leaf out of Fortnite 's book, as a new datamine has revealed that the Battle Royale's popular Audio Visualizer setting is likely coming to Black Ops 6 and Warzone . Although divisive, the Audio Visualizer is a popular choice in Fortnite , as it presents players with an on-screen indicator of the direction from which audio is coming. This is something that can offer a massive gameplay advantage in highly competitive titles such as Fortnite or Call of Duty: Warzone .

Although the Audio Visualizer feature hasn't made its way into Call of Duty just yet, developers Treyarch Studios and Raven Software recently deployed the big Season 4 Reloaded update for Black Ops 6 and Warzone , adding tons of new improvements and content to both titles. For fans of Black Ops 6 's Multiplayer, the mid-season refresh saw the return of Fringe, an iconic map last seen in 2015's Black Ops 3 . There was also the debut of a new, limited-time Beavis & Butt-Head event, Ranked Play Resurgence in Warzone , and a plethora of new weapons, blueprints, cosmetic items, and more.

With Season 4 Reloaded now live in-game, data miners such as HeyImAlaix got to work on checking out all of the new game files that were added with the mid-season update. While there were plenty of discoveries and leaks, one potential new feature has already divided the community. According to data-mined files, Call of Duty may soon have a new setting that will allow players to see footsteps and other sounds thanks to the Audio Visualizer. The file states that the setting will give gameplay and audio cues a visual component to help players determine any sounds or actions that are triggered near them.

Call of Duty Players Don't Want Audio Visualizer Added to the Game

Although popular, the ability to see footsteps in Fortnite has divided players since its introduction three years ago. While it is likely aimed at those who are hard of hearing, players quickly made use of the setting to see their enemies coming before they could hear them.

It's yet to be confirmed by Call of Duty 's development studios if the Audio Visualizer is coming to the game, or if this file is the remnants of a scrapped feature, but fans aren't happy with its potential release. Twitter user XpertFusion said they "absolutely hate" the feature in Fortnite as it is abused by most players. The user notes that it is "totally fine" as an accessibility feature, but should only be available to those who need it. Others, such as Twitter user Caffrey, even went as far as to say that they would "never play [ Call of Duty ] again" if the feature is added to the game.

If Activision does intend to add an Audio Visualizer feature to Call of Duty , it looks like it could be another controversial decision by the studio. Call of Duty has already found itself in hot water with fans multiple times this season, with players recently expressing their disdain for Black Ops 6 's Beavis & Butt-Head collaboration. Fans took to social media shortly after the announcement to blast the new cosmetic items as a "literal eyesore," as the community continues to grow tired of the shooter's unrealistic operator skins.

item.title: Once Human Cracks Down on Cheaters With 10-Year Ban Hammer
item.description:
Once Human has banned thousands of cheaters, with some receiving massive ten-year suspensions. Developer Starry Studio appears committed to improving the gameplay experience for all players while reinforcing its fair play policies for the future of Once Human .

Since its launch, Starry Studio's survival game has faced multiple controversies. Back in April, for example, some Once Human fans criticized the high price of cosmetics. However, the most persistent source of frustration has been cheaters, who are now being targeted by Starry Studio.

In a recent Steam Community post, the Once Human developer announced it had banned nearly 4,000 players between May 28 and June 29. Of these, 1,014 were penalized for cheating, alt-account and bug exploitation, and griefing other players. Notably, the developer publicly shared the list of banned players, and the standout detail is that most cheaters received 3,600-day suspensionsâ€”roughly ten years. Additionally, nearly 3,000 players were hit with temporary bans, the longest lasting 30 days, for language violations.

Once Human Cracks Down on Cheaters

Once Human recently announced some intriguing new features and teased a promising future in terms of content, but that doesn't seem to be the only focus for the developer. According to the recent announcement, the team is also working to reduce the impact of cheaters on the player experience. The game now features an updated anti-cheat system developed by reverse-engineering the most common cheats. Moreover, future updates are promised to introduce real-time in-world ban notifications and expanded channels to facilitate reporting cheaters. Other upcoming related features include displaying ban status on player namecards and ban notices on the death screen.

For those wondering, the most common cheats appear to be aimbots, ESP tools, and teleportation. These trends haven't changed much since 2024, when over 400 Once Human players were banned for ten years after using similar cheats and attempting to exploit in-game bugs and glitches.

The recent wave of bans has been met with mostly positive reactions from the community. Dedicated fans are hopeful that the developer's firm stance on cheating and its upgraded anti-cheat system will lead to a better in-game environment. Once Human isn't the only game dealing with cheaters. Major titles like Call of Duty face similar issues and are constantly working to improve their cheat detection systems. However, as cheat developers continue to adapt to anti-cheat software and algorithms, it remains a challenging task for studios to keep their games free of cheaters.

item.title: 10 Most Gory Horror Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Horror games utilize gore to disgust and terrify players, incorporating body horror in sickening enemy designs.
  • Some titles like Fear & Hunger embrace vile imagery, while others like The Evil Within offer gruesome, graphic scenes.
  • Scorn stands out for its grotesque world building, appealing to players' morbid curiosity.

Horror games are very diverse thanks to the wide range of fears and phobias that humans experience. Deep water, confined spaces, and dark expanses are all popular settings that are effective in scaring players. While some titles focus on atmosphere to really creep players out, others take a less subtle approach.

Gore is a mode of horror that appears in a multitude of subgenres, from slasher to splatter. Usually, though, at its core, gore is synonymous with body horror. Video games use gore to disgust the player, with visceral scenes that make them almost feel the pain themselves. These are some of the goriest horror games that will leave players cringing.

The titles on this list contain mature content that may not be suitable for all players.

1 Fear & Hunger

Delves Into All Things Unsavory

6 Images
6 Images
Fear & Hunger
Horror
RPG
Systems
Released
December 11, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Miro Haverinen
Publisher(s)
Happy Paintings
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Fear & Hunger is a dungeon-crawler horror RPG, known for its heavy content and subject matter. The player must navigate an ancient fortress, surviving the abominations that reside there amidst a power struggle between gods.

Because of its 2D nature, Fear & Hunger does not have as realistic gore as other titles, but it doesn't make the game any less vile. The world is morbid, and players will have to confront scenes of mutilation, violence (of all natures), and substance abuse. While not for the faint of heart, there are very few moments that feel distasteful, the gore fitting with the grim lore of the universe.

2 The Evil Within

A Detective Job Gone Violently Wrong

The Evil Within
5 /10
7.8 /10
Released
October 14, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Tango Gameworks
Publisher(s)
Bethesda
Platform(s)
Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Imagine turning up to a crime scene of a mass murder and all of a sudden being thrown into an unknown realm that's full of mutated humanoid creatures. The Evil Within brings this idea to life, following Detective Sebastian Castellanos as he attempts to get to the bottom of what exactly is going on.

Beyond the unsettling psychological horror elements, The Evil Within is a particularly gruesome title. Floors covered in pools of blood, flayed corpses, up-close encounters with surgical procedures, and blowing enemy brains out are all part and parcel of this survival horror mystery.

3 Stay Out Of The House

Escape A Savage Serial Killer Aptly Named "The Butcher"

  • Platforms: Windows, macOS, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, PS4, PS5
  • Release Date: October 14, 2022
  • Developer: Puppet Combo

It would be remiss to discuss gory horror games without any mention of Puppet Combo â€” a developer that has become an icon in the indie horror gaming community for his PS1 and 80s slasher-inspired titles. Four years after its early access reveal, Stay Out of the House was released in 2022.

The game follows Roxanne, who has fallen victim to The Butcher â€” a serial killer with a penchant for hacking up corpses. As players try to escape, while avoiding being slashed themselves, they will come across littered bodies (not always whole) and entirely blood-soaked rooms made all the more disturbing by the game's signature aesthetic.

4 The Callisto Protocol

Disturbingly True To Life Depictions Of Death

The Callisto Protocol
7 /10
8.3 /10
Released
December 2, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Striking Distance Studios
Publisher(s)
Krafton
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

The Callisto Protocol is a survival horror game set in space. After crash-landing on Callisto, the player, as freight captain Jacob, is imprisoned in the planet's Black Iron Prison, where a disease has turned the inmates into "biophages." The player must fend off the threats and learn the origins of the outbreak.

The team behind The Callisto Protocol looked to real-life examples of gore â€” the likes of war and car crashes â€” during development to nail the game's realism. There are plenty of graphic scenes; strung up corpses, brutal death animations, and bloody combat. Players can even throw the mutated biophages into machinery, shredding them into chunks.

The Callisto Protocol is considered the spiritual successor to Dead Space , which is also incredibly gory.

5 Splatterhouse (2010)

The Evolution Of A Slasher Beat 'Em Up Classic

  • Platforms: Xbox 360, PlayStation 3
  • Release Date: November 23, 2010
  • Developer: Bandai Namco

Splatterhouse was originally a beat-em-up arcade game, and it received a number of sequels in a similar style. In 2010, Bandai Namco published a reboot â€” a 3D re-imagining of the original that opened up new possibilities for the direction of the franchise.

Players control the superhuman, bloodthirsty Rick, who is on a mission to save his girlfriend from the sinister plans of Dr. West. In keeping with the arcade title, which was banned in the US for its graphic content, the 2010 Splatterhouse is just as gory, complete with hack-and-slash gameplay and brutal "Splatter Kills."

Splatterhouse (2010) is no longer available to purchase outside of existing physical copies.

6 Evil Dead: The Game

Players Can Fight Back And Make Their Own Mess

Evil Dead: The Game
6 /10
7.0 /10
Released
May 13, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Saber Interactive
Publisher(s)
Saber Interactive
Franchise
Evil Dead
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X
Powered by

When the original The Evil Dead film was released in 1981, few expected it to become the iconic franchise it is today. The gory practical effects and over-the-top scenarios became its trademark, something that many fans praise Evil Dead: The Game for paying homage to.

The title is an asymmetrical horror game, with players either taking the side of the iconic group of heroes or the formidable supernatural army of Kandarian demons. With plenty of gunplay and hack-and-slash action, there is no shortage of bloody combat or flying limbs.

7 Resident Evil 7: Biohazard

A Nauseating Depiction Of The Deep South

Resident Evil 7: Biohazard
13
8.9 /10
Released
January 24, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Capcom
Publisher(s)
Capcom
Franchise
Resident Evil
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Switch, Stadia, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Resident Evil 7: Biohazard marked the franchise's shift from the combat-focus of the previous games back into a more survival horror-based experience with a first-person perspective and a new story arc. Players follow new protagonist Ethan Winters as he ventures to Louisiana in search of his wife, Mia.

Unfortunately, this leads him to the home of a mold-infected cannibal family whose favorite sport is dispatching ungrateful dinner guests. Not only is the residence full of gross rotting guts, but players are also repeatedly put into situations that make them feel helpless, experiencing Ethan getting stabbed, battered, and dismembered on the regular.

8 The Outlast Trials

Forces Players To Do Awful Things To Survive

The Outlast Trials
7 /10
7.0 /10
Released
May 18, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Red Barrels
Publisher(s)
Red Barrels
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

The Outlast franchise is notorious for having some of the most disturbing content in the survival horror genre, both in plot and environment. The prequel, The Outlast Trials , is no exception, putting players through "therapy" that will make them prime candidates for serving Murkoff as sleeper agents.

Unfortunately, this therapy involves completing twisted objectives, which not only include avoiding violent enemies with brutal modi operandi, but, unlike the other two games, inflicting various methods of nauseating torture on other characters. If they can find anyone willing to endure the trauma, players can go co-op for a better chance of making it out alive.

9 Agony

Takes Religious Descriptions Of Hell To The Extreme

3 Images
3 Images
Agony
Survival Horror
Systems
Released
May 29, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Madmind Studio
Publisher(s)
Forever Entertainment, PlayWay
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Switch, Xbox One
Powered by

In scripture, Hell is portrayed as a fiery realm of eternal punishment and suffering. While many games set in Hell feature demons and barren, lava-filled landscapes, Agony takes a more explicit approach. Players are presented with horrific scenes at every turn, from architecture made of body parts to graphic images of torture.

Agony was originally rated "Adult Only" but was later toned down to an M rating. While this meant censoring alot of the overt content, the uncensored Unrated version of the game is still available. What the game lacks in polish and gameplay, the beautifully awful gore largely makes up for.

10 Scorn

Gross From Start To Finish

Scorn
2 /10
10.0 /10
Released
October 14, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Ebb Software
Publisher(s)
Ebb Software
Franchise
Scorn
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox Series X
Powered by

Scorn is perhaps one of the most visually striking survival horror games. Very little is given away about the plot, and the game barely holds players' hands at all, but the visceral and grotesque world building is enough for many to overlook the lack of context and long sections of exploration.

The land that the protagonist must traverse seems anchored in pain and suffering, with mangled abominations â€” some hostile and some pitiful â€” crawling their way around. Even the world itself is organic, the architecture and mechanisms seemingly made of flesh, bone, and sinew. Scorn is an all-around skin-crawling experience that appeals to players' morbid curiosity.
